<!-- Page 1 -->

# DIAGNOSTIC CRITERIA
_clinical, radiographic and microbiolog_
_NTM pulmonary disease_

**Handwritten Notes (Yellow Sticky Note):**
Clinical: pulm & systemic symptoms
Radiologic: Nodular, Cavitary / Bronchiectasis & Multiple small nodules
Appropriate Exclusion of other diagnoses
Microbiologic:
Sputum: 2 samples +ve; BAL: 1 sample +ve
Biopsy: Granulomatous inflammation + culture +ve
Granulomatous inflammation + culture +ve @ BAL +ve
or
AFB

## Table 2 Clinical and Microbiologic Criteria for Diagnosis of Nontuberculous Mycobacterial Pulmonary Disease

# DRUG SUSCEPTIBILITY TESTING

*In vitro susceptibility to certain agents strongly predicts clinical outcomes.*

*Current recommendations are to test for MAC and MAb susceptibility to <u>macrolides</u> and <u>amikacin</u>.*

*In the case of MAb, molecular methods or a <u>14-day hold</u> for <u>culture</u> may further be necessary to evaluate for an inducible erm gene conferring macrolide resistance.*

*Guidelines also support testing of <u>M. kansasii</u> for susceptibility to <u>rifampin</u>.*

---
**Handwritten Notes:**

*   *(Top right, above the "E A R" box):* sperm abt
*   *(Top right, a box/circle containing):* E A R
    *   *(Below E):* +
    *   *(Below A):* th, ro
    *   *(Below R):* d, m
*   *(To the right of the "E A R" box, connected by a "+"):*
    *   -> Amikaan
    *   -> FQ
*   *(Next to "MAb"):* Abolenus
*   *(Below "rifampin"):* P
*   *(Below "M. kansasii"):* P
*   *(Bottom center):* DR. BHARATH KATHI MD, DNB, FIP, FACI, EDARM

---

<!-- Page 3 -->

# M. avium complex: PD (Pul Disease) (EAR regimes)

Recommend a 3-drug regimen that includes a macrolide

## NTM (Susceptibility Duration)

*   **MAC**
    *   **Test:**
        *   Macrolides
        *   Amikacin
    *   **Duration:**
        *   12 months after sputum conversion (minimum)
        *   *Handwritten:* At least 14 months after sputum conversion
        *   *Handwritten:* EAR + Inj Am [Daily] [Alt day]
        *   *Handwritten:* Refractory
        *   *Handwritten:* Refractory as [Culture (+) after 6 months of Rx]

## Disease Category & Dosing Regimen (Minimum of Three Drugs)

### Nodular-bronchiectatic

*   Dosed thrice weekly (*Handwritten:* Alt day)
    *   Ethambutol 25 mg/kg po
    *   Rifampin 600 mg po
    *   Azithromycin 500 mg po

### Cavitary, extensive, or macrolide-resistant

*   Dosed daily (*Handwritten:* Dosed daily)
    *   Ethambutol 15 mg/kg po
    *   Rifampin 450-600 mg (10 mg/kg) po
    *   Azithromycin 250-500 mg po
*   Dosed thrice weekly (*Handwritten:* Dosed thrice weekly)
    *   Amikacin 15-25 mg/kg

### Refractory

*   Dosed daily
    *   Ethambutol 15 mg/kg po
    *   Rifampin 450-600 mg (10 mg/kg) po
    *   Azithromycin 250-500 mg po
    *   **and**
        *   ALIS 590 mg inhaled daily
    *   **or**
        *   Amikacin 15-25 mg/kg thrice weekly

## Additional Notes

*   Azithromycin >> clarithromycin (↑↑ADRs & BD dosing)
*   Rifampin is preferred over rifabutin
*   Daily dosing of the oral regimen, along with 2 to 3 months of an aminoglycoside, is used for severe or cavitary disease, as well as for macrolide resistance. Clofazimine and Bedaquiline, also may be considered.
*   Refractory disease is defined as remaining sputum culture positive after 6 months of guideline-based therapy.
*   Amikacin liposome inhalation suspension (ALIS) helpful in treatment refractory patients with MAC pulmonary disease.

---

<!-- Page 4 -->

# Mycobacterium abscessus - Most resistant NTM

*3 or more active drugs recommended* XP
The panel members felt strongly that treatment regimens should be designed in collaboration with experts in the management of these complicated infections
≥ 3 active drugs
MAb as a whole are the most resistant NTMs XP
and outcomes are often suboptimal in the absence of surgical resection of diseased lung ✓
1-2 IV A-ICT + 2 oral
- Amikaan + Imipnem ✓
[cefexitin, Tisecyclu] - [clofazamine] -
✓ Autho + Linezolid

✓ Initial therapy (1-2 IV, 2 oral, ≥3 active drugs)
IV:
{ Amikacin 15-25 mg/kg IV thrice weekly
{ Imipenem 500-1000 mg IV 2-3 times daily
{ Cefoxitin 2-4 g IV 3 times daily
{ Tigecycline 25-50 mg IV 1-2 times daily
Oral: T-25
✓ Azithromycin 250-500 mg daily -
{ Clofazimine 100-200 mg daily
✓ Linezolid 600 mg 1-2 times daily -
Continuation phase (≥2 active drugs)
Oral agents as above
ALIS 590 mg daily inhaled ✓

IDSA FEATURES
Absces -> ICT

Treatment of Nontuberculous Mycobacterial Pulmonary Disease: An Official ATS/ERS/ESCMID/IDSA Clinical Practice Guideline

Charles L. Daley, Jonathan M. Iaccarino, Christoph Lange, Emmanuelle Cambau, Richard J. Wallace, Jr., Claire Andrejak, Erik C. Böttger, Jan Brozek, David E. Griffith, Lorenzo Guglielmetti, Gwen A. Huitt, Shandra L. Knight, Philip Lailman, Theodore K. Marras, Kenneth N. Olivier, Miguel Santin, Jason E. Stout, Enrico Tortoli, Jakko van Ingen, Dirk Wagner, and Kevin L. Winthrop

DR. BHARATH KATHI MD, DNB, FIP, FACI, EDARM

---

<!-- Page 7 -->

# NTM-PD SURGERY
*   failure of medical management,
*   cavitary disease,
*   drug resistant isolates, or
*   complications such as hemoptysis or severe bronchiectasis
*   The decision to proceed with surgical resection must be weighed against the risks and benefits of surgery.

Surgical resection of limited (focal) disease in a patient with adequate cardiopulmonary reserve to withstand partial or complete lung resection can be successful in combination with multidrug treatment regimens.

*Handwritten note:* Path Dissem

---

<!-- Page 8 -->

# Follow-up

## Radiological response

*   A CT scan should be performed \*
    *   Shortly before starting NTM treatment
    *   and
    *   At the end of NTM treatment \*
    To document the radiological response to treatment.
*   CT-directed bronchial wash

## Microbiological response

*   To assess the microbiological response, samples should be sent for mycobacterial culture (e.g., lung lavage, fine needle aspiration)
    *   Every 4-12 weeks during treatment
    *   12 months after completing treatment
*   CT-directed bronchial wash \*
    *   Doubt about persisting NTM infection despite negative sputum cultures ✓
    *   Unable to expectorate sputum (after 6 and 12 months of treatment) ✓
        *   (Handwritten: If we have a reference)
        *   (Handwritten: If we have a reference)

---

<!-- Page 9 -->

# MANAGEMENT OF COINFECTION

Coinfection with <mark>multiple NTMs</mark> - <mark>MAC</mark>, <mark>M. kansasii</mark>, and/or M. <u>xenopi</u> are treated with a regimen consisting of ethambutol, a rifamycin, and a macrolide. (EAR)

In <mark>MAC</mark> and <mark>Mab</mark> co infection <s>X A X</s>
* When the <mark>MAb</mark> is <mark>macrolide-sensitive</mark>, <mark>initiate treatment for</mark> <mark>MAC and MAb</mark> <u>simultaneously</u> to avoid <u>development of MAb macrolide resistance</u>.
* If the <mark>MAb is macrolide-resistant</mark>, <u>starting with <mark>MAC therapy</mark></u>, which is more likely to be tolerated; subsequently, agents active against MAb are added.

---

<!-- Page 10 -->

# Drugs in NTM

\* **Usual drugs** \*
*   Rifampicin (E)
*   Ethambutol (A)
*   Azithromycin (R)
    *   `250-500 OD`
    *   `+ Extensive` (arrow from R to this, and then to Am)
*   Amikacin
    *   `15-25 mg/day`
    *   `Inj (Am)`

**Others**
*   ALIS `✓ 590 mg daily`
*   Bedaquiline }
*   Clofazamine `→ 100-200mg OD/BD`
*   `✓` Linezolid `→ 400-600 OD`
*   `✓` Tigecycline `→ 25-50mg OD/BD`
*   `✓` Fluoroquinolones

---

<!-- Page 11 -->

Oral

sectionTitle: | Drug | Daily Dosing | Thrice Weekly Dosing | Hep

content:
---

<!-- Page 12 -->

Parenteral

| Drug | Daily Dosing | Thrice Weekly Dosing | Hepatic Impairment | Renal Impairment |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| Amikacin (IV) | 10-15 mg/kg per day, adjusted according to drug level monitoringᵃ | 15-25 mg/kg per day, adjusted according to drug level monitoringᵃ | N/A | Reduce dose or increase dosing interval (eg, 15 mg/kg, 2-3 times per week) |
| Cefoxitin (IV) | 2-4 g 2-3 times daily (maximum daily dose is 12 g/day) | N/A | N/A | Reduce dose or increase dosing interval |
| Imipenem (IV) | 500-1000 mg, 2-3 times per day | N/A | N/A | Reduce dose or increase dosing interval |
| Streptomycin (IV or IM) | 10-15 mg/kg per day, adjusted according to drug level monitoring | 15-25 mg/kg per day, adjusted according to drug level monitoring | N/A | Reduce dose or increase dosing interval (eg, 15 mg/kg, 2-3 times per week) |
| Tigecycline (IV) | 25-50 mg once or twice per day | N/A | 25 mg once or twice daily per day in severe hepatic impairment | N/A |

---

<!-- Page 13 -->

| Drug                                     | Daily Dosing        | Thrice Weekly Dosing | Hepatic Impairment | Renal Impairment |
| :--------------------------------------- | :------------------ | :------------------- | :----------------- | :--------------- |
| Inhalation                               |                     |                      |                    |                  |
| Amikacin liposome inhalation suspension  | 590 mg per day      | N/A                  | N/A                | N/A              |
| Amikacin, parenteral formulation         | 250-500 mg per day  | N/A                  | N/A                | N/A              |
